intro: Atylosia albicans, commonly known as the white sagebrush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Atylosia albicans thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and open woodlands. Its aromatic foliage and adaptability to harsh conditions make it a notable species in its native range.
